arg2.description:
A json object or an array of json objects encoded as a string. Each json object must have a valid xpath. Each json object may be standalone or nested. If the object identified by the xpath does not exist it will be created otherwise it will be updated. The object content must conform to the object schemas defined under #/components/schemas. The IxNetwork data model is a hierarchical recursive model and as a result all of the configuration nodes have been flattened under #/components/schemas. Child nodes are nested using the $ref keyword.
The following configurations detail the required top level nodes that need to be created. Raw traffic configuration: - #/components/schemas/vport - #/components/schemas/traffic
Device traffic configuration: - #/components/schemas/vport - #/components/schemas/topology - #/components/schemas/globals_topology - #/components/schemas/traffic

arg3.description: True to clear the current configuration before importing the configuration. False to update the current configuration.

post.description: Create a new configuration or update an existing configuration

enableEgressOnlyTracking.description: This flags enables/disables egress only tracking. In this mode only traffic without ingress tracking is supported on ports with egress only settings, user will have only PGID stats and the packets will not contain any instrumentation block.

useRfc5952.description: Use RFC 5952 for formatting IPv6 addresses (:ffff:1.2.3.4)

enableEgressOnlyTxStats.description: This flags enables/disables egress only tx stats. In this mode all traffic without ingress tracking is considered for tx stats.

egressOnlyTrafficItemName.description: Traffic Item name for egress only flows in statistics.

autoCorrectL4HeaderChecksums.description: This is used for Multis and Xdensity as checksum is not calculated correctly when change on the fly operations are performed. When this option is enabled IxOS uses 2 bytes before CRC, that way ensuring the checksum is correct when change on the fly operations are performed.

isEditable.description: Information on the requirement of the field.

enum.description: Internal enumeration type used to restrict possible field values.

name.description: Name of the TLV field.

isRequired.description: Information on the requirement of the field.

sizeType.description: The size types/data unit of the field.

singleValue.description: If true the field can only be configured with a single value pattern.

isRepeatable.description: Information if the field can be multiplied in the tlv definition.

size.description: The size of the field in bytes. Field size must be greater or equal to 0. For automatic detection set size to 0.

xpath.description:
Identifies an object's location in the configuration. The xpath syntax is a very specific subset of xpath 1.0 and it's syntax is dictated by the node's full path and x-crud. The root of every xpath must be / which is equivalent to the #/components/schemas/ixnetwork node.
Rules: if x-crud: [read, update] the node is required and the xpath must end with only name if x-crud: [create, read, update, delete] xpath must end with a 1 based ordinal if name ends with 'multivalue' xpath must be
Example mappings of OpenAPI #/components/schemas/.../<node> to xpath: #/components/schemas/ixnetwork xpath: '/'
#/components/schemas/ixnetwork/vport xpath: '/vport[1]'
#/components/schemas/ixnetwork/traffic/trafficItem/configElement/stack xpath: '/traffic/trafficItem[1]/configElement[1]/stack[@alias='ethernet-1']' note: the stack alias is the stackTypeId
#/components/schemas/ixnetwork/traffic/trafficItem/configElement/stack/field xpath: '/traffic/trafficItem[1]/configElement[1]/stack[@alias='ethernet-1']/field[@alias='ethernet.header.etherType-3']'
#/components/schemas/ixnetwork/topology/deviceGroup/enabled xpath: '/multivalue[@source='/topology[1]/deviceGroup[1] enabled']'
Additional Help: Using the IxNetwork UI create a configuration that contains the resource you are interested in. Export that configuration using the resourceManager. Use an editor to find the resource you are interested in and its associated xpath.

dhcp4ClientPort.description: UDP port that the client listens on for DHCP and BOOTP responses.

renewOnLinkUp.description: Indicate to renew the active DHCP sessions after link status goes down and up.

dhcp4ResponseTimeout.description: The initial time, in seconds, that the subnet waits to receive a response from a DHCP server.

name.description: Name of NGPF element, guaranteed to be unique in Scenario

skipReleaseOnStop.description: If enabled, the client does not send a DHCPRELEASE packet when the Stop command is given.

dhcp4ResponseTimeoutFactor.description: The factor by which the timeout will be multiplied each time the response timeout has been reached.

dhcp4MaxDiscoverTimeout.description: The max value, in seconds, that the discover timeout can reach though Discover Timeout Factor.

dhcp4ServerPort.description: UDP port that the client addresses server requests to.

dhcp4NumRetry.description: Number of times that the client will retransmit a request for which it has not received a response. When the maximum number of retransmitions is reached, the port will increment the failure counter (DHCPSetupFail).

dhcp4ArpGw.description: If enabled, DHCP clients ARP to find their Gateway MAC Addresses.

interMarkerPDUDelayRandomMin.description: Inter Marker PDU Delay Random Min (sec)

stackedLayers.description: List of secondary (many to one) child layer protocols

connectedVia.description: List of layers this layer used to connect to the wire

multiplier.description: Number of layer instances per parent instance (multiplier)

interMarkerPDUDelayRandomMax.description: Inter Marker PDU Delay Random Max (sec)

sendMarkerRequestOnLagChange.description: Send Marker Request On Lag Change

protocolStackingMode.description: Decides whether protocol's sessions will started sequentially or parallelly across the layers

ngpfProtocolRateMode.description: Decides whether protocol's sessions will started in normal or smooth mode

globals_tlvEditor.description: Tlv template functionality is contained under this node

name.description: TBD

allowEmptyTopologySets.description: Enable this to allow the setting of sources and destinations without throwing an error even if the combination produces an empty topology set.

multicastReceivers.description: A list of virtual multicast receivers. Each list item consists of a multicast receiver object reference, port index, host index and group or join/prune index depending on the type of object reference.

multicastDestinations.description: A compact representation of many virtual multicast destinations. Each list item consists of 5 values where the first two, a bool value and enum value, can be defaulted to false and none. The next two values are a starting address and step address which can be either an ipv4, ipv6 or streamId and the last value is a count of addresses.

enable.description: Enable frame preemption on the given stream. Disabled indicates an express frame

fragmentCount.description: Set the fragment count (a value between 0 and 3)

autoFragmentCount.description: Let the fragments be auto counted

lastFragment.description: Indicates if this is the last fragment of the preemptable packet

successiveStart.description: The number of EAPOL Start messages sent when the supplicant starts the process of authentication. Max value is 100

fragmentSize.description: The maximum size of a fragment that can be sent on the wire for TLS fragments that comprise the phase 1 conversation (tunnel establishment). Max value is 1400

maxStart.description: The number of times to send EAPOL Start frames for which no response is received before declaring that the sessions have timed out. Max value is 100

waitBeforeRun.description: The number of secs to wait before running the protocol.Maximum wait is 500

onlyMulticast.description: Specify if destination MAC address can be multicast.

getCACertOnly.description: Use this option to get CA Certificate Only. Eg: For PEAPv0/v1 case there is no need to get User Certificate.

maxOutstandingRequests.description: The maximum number of sessions that can be negotiated at one moment. Max value is 1024

disableLogoff.description: Do not send Logoff message when closing a session.

name.description: Name of NGPF element, guaranteed to be unique in Scenario

macAuthPrefix.description: When using machine authentication, a prefix is needed to differentiate between users and machines.

authOnNoResponse.description: If the DUT is not responding to EAPoL Start after configured number of retries, declare the session a success

startPeriod.description: The time interval between successive EAPOL Start messages sent by a Supplicant.Maxium value is 3600

useVlanIdentify.description: Specify if VLAN is to be used to identify the supplicants

authWaitPeriod.description: The maximum time interval, measured in seconds, that a Supplicant will wait for an Authenticator response.Maximum value is 3600

dutTestMode.description: Specify what is the dut port mode

maxSetupRate.description: The number of interfaces to setup per second. Max rate is 1024

maxTeardownRate.description: The number of interfaces to tear down per second. Max value is 1024
